title: ğŸ“˜ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» About the Blog and About Me
text:
Technologies Used

Quarto: rendering .qmd files into HTML

RevealJS: interactive presentations

MathJax: mathematical formulas

AWS S3 or GitHub Pages: static hosting

TikZ (exported to PNG/SVG): diagrams

Bootstrap theme cosmo + custom styles.scss

title: ğŸ“˜ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» About the Blog and About Me
text:
General Structure

index.qmd: homepage

posts/*.qmd: individual posts

posts/pessoal/sobre-o-blog.qmd: this â€œAboutâ€ page

images/: images

_quarto.yml: site configuration

title: ğŸ“˜ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» About the Blog and About Me
section: ğŸ› ï¸ How This Project Works
text:
ğŸ› ï¸ How This Project Works

ğŸ“œ Active Scripts

atualizar-ultimos-posts.sh
Generates the list of the most recent posts by date and saves it in a reusable block (e.g., ultimos_posts.qmd).
gerar_posts_json.py
Scans all .qmd files and extracts metadata (title, tags, path) to generate docs/posts.json, used in tag pages and navigation.
gerar_tags.py
Reads posts.json and generates tags_freq.txt, tags.qmd, and lista_tags_gerada.html with the frequency of each tag.
nuvem_tags.py
Creates nuvem_tags.png (a word cloud with tag frequencies), displayed on the tags navigation page.
atualizar_tags.sh
Creates individual pages for each tag (tags/*.qmd), updates tags.qmd with links, and regenerates the word cloud.
atualizar_tudo.sh
Runs everything in order (latest posts â†’ JSON â†’ tags â†’ word cloud), ensuring the site is updated with a single command.


â† Back to the Personal Blog Section ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ«

ğŸ” Back to Top

Blog do Marcellini â€” Exploring Mathematics, Statistics, and Physics with Rigor and Beauty.

title: Quiz example
text:
This document illustrates the usage of the naquiz quarto extension.
The extension enables adding multiple choice questions when using HTML documents. It also adds Alpine.js javascript framework to the document.

title: Marcellini's Blog
text:
âœ¨ Highlights






ğŸ§  Historical Equations (Mathematics + Physics)





A selection of formulas that shaped science, such as Eulerâ€™s Identity \(e^{i\pi}+1=0\) and the Wave Equation.
Explore Historical Equations â€º









ğŸŒ Normal Distribution â€” Course (Statistics)





Why does normality appear so often? Probabilities, confidence intervals, and hypothesis tests â€” with charts and exercises.
See the course â€º









ğŸ“˜ Calculus Course â€” Introduction





A progressive course that combines mathematical rigor, LaTeX typographical quality, and practical examples in R and Python.
ğŸ“Œ Topics already covered:

Number sets and fundamental properties

Step-by-step solved exercises

ğŸ‘‰ Follow the Calculus Course â€º







ğŸ”§ Programmable examples:
ğŸ‘‰ Python Models Â· ğŸ‘‰ R Models

title: ğŸ§­ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ« Reading Guide â€” Personal Blog
text:
1 About this Guide
This space gathers reflections, notes, and paths I have been following in the study of Mathematics and related fields.
The proposal is to share a suggested reading order, combining authorial texts and behind-the-scenes in a structured way â€” from introduction to deepening â€” always with conceptual rigor and accessible language.

title: ğŸ§­ ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ« Reading Guide â€” Personal Blog
text:
3 ğŸ“… Coming Soon
A preview of upcoming texts planned for the Personal Blog:

How I study mathematics daily â€” routine, readings, and notes.

Tools I use â€” Quarto, LaTeX, R/Python, and project organization.

Behind the Blog â€” publishing pipeline (folder structure, Git, deploy).

Scientific design â€” typographic choices, figures, and diagram standards.

Editorial roadmap â€” how I decide the sequence of posts and series.


When each text is published, it will automatically appear here and in the section index.
